awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Problems in Dynamical Systems from   Celestial Mechanics
awd_abstract_narration: Glen Hall will carry out research into problems in the                     theory of dynamical systems motivated by celestial mechanics.                        Hall will focus his attention on two problems in particular.               The first is the study of exact symplectic twist diffeomorphisms                of four dimensions. The goal is to give examples of pathological                behavior, give regularity theorems of invariant sets and obtain a               better understanding of the topology of periodic orbits. The                    second problem is the study of central configurations,                          particularly extreme cases of a few large masses and many small                 equal masses. The goal is to find techniques for these extreme                  cases which will allow extensions of these results to the n-body                problem and will include analytic and numerical work.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
